alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Hurricane Local Statement issued June 04 at 11:20AM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: This product covers the Florida Keys **Tropical Storm Warning has been canceled for all Florida Keys** NEW INFORMATION --------------- * CHANGES TO WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - All watches and warnings have been canceled * CURRENT WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - None * STORM INFORMATION: - About 140 miles north of Key West FL or about 120 miles north of Marathon FL or about 110 miles north-northwest of Key Largo FL - 26.5N 81.4W - Storm Intensity 40 mph - Movement Northeast or 45 degrees at 18 mph SITUATION OVERVIEW ------------------ Although the tropical storm warnings have been canceled, there is still potential for minor coastal flooding along the Gulfside/Bayside through this afternoon until waters drain, especially over the bayside communities in the Upper Keys. NEXT UPDATE ----------- This will be the last local statement issued by the National Weather Service in Key West FL regarding the effects of Potential Tropical Cyclone One hazards upon the area.

area.areaDesc: Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys
